title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.1: CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Policies and plans are in place to scale up child protection interventions, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children at risk of violence, abuse and exploitation benefit from improved prevention, protection and response interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policies and plans are in place to scale up child protection interventions

description.narrative: Throughout 2021, UNICEF supported government Institutions to enhance child protection systems and enforcement mechanisms to prevent and respond to violence, exploitation and neglect of children. UNICEF also supported multiple major interventions with a direct impact on the advancement of protection of boys and girls, starting with the development of the law to protection from Domestic Violence and of a three-year National Plan on Child Protection. Together with the Plan to respond to the recommendations of the CRC, this will create momentum for strengthening the protective environment for children and women. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2022
